meta.title: Shriver’s Complex Substrate Theory (CST)
meta.subtitle: A Phase Transitional Model of Cosmic Substrate Dynamics
meta.intended_use: Research articulation, simulation scaffolding, prediction tracking, and experimental design planning.

substrate.description: Universal equilibrium medium representing the stable, lowest-energy state of cosmic material.
properties: Supports wave-like excitations that transport/redistribute energy
Acts as the sink and source in excitation cycles while conserving total energy

excitation.description: Any temporary, higher-energy configuration within the substrate, including baryonic matter and radiation.
excitation.fate: Ultimately decays and reintegrates into the substrate through energy redistribution.

photon.description: Metastable, self-propagating oscillation of the substrate; massless by definition (no rest frame).
photon.end_state: Dissolves into substrate via damping (redshift → ν ↓) without violating conservation.

black_hole.description: Scale-shift region where local energy density exceeds current spatial accommodation capacity, transitioning physics to a new regime within the substrate.
black_hole.temporal_behavior: Local time slows relative to distant cosmic time as densities approach the black-hole limit; crossing the horizon still yields finite proper time before singular interior evolution.
black_hole.interpretation: Infinities indicate breakdown of model applicability, not physical reality.

phi.physical_meaning: Local substrate phase fraction (0 ≈ pure equilibrium substrate; 1 ≈ fully excited/structured phase).
phi.role: Controls effective stress-energy correction and medium response.

f.physical_meaning: Global fraction of total energy bound in excitations.
f.relation_to_phi: f is the volume- or energy-weighted average of local excitation across the cosmos.

axioms: A1: The universe possesses a stable equilibrium substrate state that minimizes free energy at large scales.
A2: Ordinary matter and radiation are temporary excitations of the substrate and ultimately decay back to equilibrium.
A3: Conservation of total energy holds globally; no exceptions are invoked for cosmological processes.
A4: Apparent infinities (e.g., singularities) signal a change of scale/regime (scale-shift), not literal divergence of physical quantities.
A5: Macroscopic gravitational phenomenology emerges from GR coupled to an effective stress-energy that includes substrate-phase contributions.

total_energy.statement: E_T is conserved globally across substrate and excitations.

partition.evolution: df/dt ≤ 0 on long timescales due to decay and energy return to substrate, modulated by transient sourcing events.

photons.nature: Metastable substrate oscillations; massless because they are non-material wave modes without rest frame.
photons.speed_of_light: c represents the substrate’s maximum redistribution rate for excitation energy.

redshift_mechanism.statement: Frequency decreases via energy leakage (damping) into the substrate during propagation; this complements or can partially replace metric-expansion redshift.
phenomenology: Environment-dependent redshift component correlated with substrate density ρ_s
Cumulative effect over long path lengths

equations.intensity_decay: dI/dx = -α(ρ_s) I  (Beer–Lambert–like phenomenology for energy leakage)

predictions.claim: Residual, environment-dependent redshift beyond pure metric expansion scaling.
predictions.observable: Δz_env correlated with line-of-sight ρ_s proxies.

predictions.claim: Spectral softening with path through higher ρ_s regions without corresponding lensing signatures of additional mass.

falsification: No statistically significant environment-correlated redshift residuals after controlling for selection and peculiar velocities across multiple independent surveys.

black_holes.scale_shift_view: Black holes are regions where classical spacetime description hands off to substrate-regime rules due to insufficient spatial accommodation at current scale.
black_holes.temporal_dilation: As local energy density approaches the black-hole limit, local time dilates relative to cosmic time; horizon crossing yields finite proper time to interior endpoints.
handoff_rules: Replace divergent quantities with effective parameters determined by substrate state variables
Treat interior evolution as energy redistribution pathways preserving global conservation
observables: Waveform features at merger ringdown potentially deviating slightly from classical expectations if substrate coupling is nonzero
Accretion dynamics or jet properties influenced by scale-shift boundary conditions rather than true singularities
falsification: High-precision ringdown and shadow measurements strictly matching classical GR in all regimes where CST predicts order-ε deviations with ε bounded below by instrument sensitivity.

energy_partition.comment: f is time-dependent; cosmic evolution trends toward f → 0 under damping.

free_energy.definition: ℱ(φ) = a φ^2 + b φ^4 + κ |∇φ|^2 - J ρ_b φ
free_energy.coupling: Linear baryon–substrate coupling via J ρ_b φ (minimal phenomenological choice).

mathematical_framework.euler_lagrange_for_phi: 2 a φ + 4 b φ^3 - J ρ_b - κ ∇^2 φ = 0
mathematical_framework.constitutive_relation: ΔT_{μν} = α(φ) g_{μν} + β(φ) u_μ u_ν + γ(φ) ∇_μ φ ∇_ν φ

a.prior: negative; magnitude sets depth of double-well

α(φ), β(φ), γ(φ).role: phenomenological mapping from phase state to effective stress corrections

stages: S1: Disturbance in equilibrium substrate nucleates excitations
S2: Excitations complexify into structures (stars, galaxies)
S3: Collapse and radiative release; radiation propagates and damps (redshifts) into substrate
S4: Return toward equilibrium until next cycle
cyclic_evolution.entropy_trend: Net increase across cycles (directional arrow of time), with transient pockets of low entropy enabling structure.

global_fraction_evolution.interpretation: Linear/quadratic decay terms for spontaneous and interaction-driven decay; S(t) for episodic sourcing (e.g., mergers, inflows).

predictive_distinctions.claim: Temperature anisotropies contain convection/gyration signatures indicative of substrate flows, not purely metric expansion geometry.
predictive_distinctions.test: Higher-order multipole residuals correlated with large-scale flow templates.

predictive_distinctions.claim: Rotation–lensing discrepancies emerge from phase-structure rather than unseen particle halos.
predictive_distinctions.test: Fit curves using φ-mediated ΔT_{μν} and compare to NFW; expect systematic deviations near phase boundaries where ∇φ peaks.

predictive_distinctions.claim: Redshift includes an environment-dependent damping component scaling with substrate density proxies.
predictive_distinctions.test: Hubble residual analysis vs. line-of-sight environment metrics.

predictive_distinctions.claim: Entanglement coherence length co-varies with substrate state variables.
predictive_distinctions.test: Measure decoherence vs. local gravitational potential or other substrate proxies.

programs.goal: Search for convection-like flow patterns in the cosmic web.
Detect substrate-flow (gyration) imprints in CMB anisotropies.
Rotation and lensing fits using ΔT_{μν}(φ) models.
Environment-correlated Hubble residuals indicating damping component.
controls: host galaxy mass, metallicity, dust, peculiar velocities

laboratory_experiments.setup: Quantum superposition duration vs. local gravitational potential and environmental proxies.
laboratory_experiments.prediction: τ_dec varies with substrate state; detectable at precision Δτ/τ ~ 10^-n (n experiment-dependent).

laboratory_experiments.setup: Track detailed energy redistribution in fission/fusion to search for anomalous leakage patterns consistent with substrate coupling.
laboratory_experiments.note: Should respect ordinary conservation; any deviations must map to accounted channels or bound coupling coefficients.

laboratory_experiments.setup: Measure light-speed stability and spectral evolution across gradient potentials.
laboratory_experiments.prediction: No superluminal effects; possible tiny substrate-correlated spectral adjustments.

laboratory_experiments.setup: Condensed-matter/fluid analogs with two-phase media to emulate φ dynamics.
laboratory_experiments.goal: Identify universal behavior and measurable scaling laws applicable to CST.

quantum_implications.statement: Quantum states reflect substrate-mediated coherence; entanglement length and stability depend on substrate variables.
quantum_implications.testable_link: Correlate decoherence rates with gravitational potential or other environment proxies as first-order substrate indicators.

theoretical: Causality preserved: no superluminal signaling; c is a hard ceiling set by substrate redistribution rate.
Stability of φ dynamics (no runaway in physical regimes).
astrophysical: Solar-system precision tests: ensure ε-level corrections well below measurement limits.
BBN and early-universe constraints: φ and f must not disrupt observed light-element abundances within uncertainties.

glossary.substrate: Equilibrium medium underlying all phenomena; stable, non-luminous.
glossary.phase transition: Change in state characterized by order parameter φ.
glossary.scale-shift: Change of effective physical rules/parameters due to exceeding accommodation capacity at a given scale (e.g., inside black holes).
glossary.redshift (damping): Loss of photon energy into substrate resulting in frequency decrease over propagation.

milestones.goal: Derive φ-based ΔT_{μν} forms consistent with solar-system bounds.
Implement toy halo solver + lensing integrals; release notebooks.
Environment-dependent redshift residual analysis plan and mock pipeline.
ArXiv-ready manuscript with figures, parameter bounds, and public code.

O3: Consistency with early-universe thermodynamics and CMB power spectrum.
